subject: Hello Friend,
body:
Hello Friend,
The International Monetary Fund IMF is compensating all the scam
victims with the sum of  $1,500.000usd (One Million Five Hundred
Thousand )  and your email address was found in the scam victim's list
for this mid- quarter of the year payment.
We have been mandated by the World Bank(WB) to ensure your
compensation is received by you through a correspondent bank in
Europe. We need your information for re-confirmation and also filing
as well such as, your full names, working telephone number,
occupation, marital status, next of kin and possibly your identity
copy as well.
Note that your payment file will be returned to the World Bank within
72 hours if we did not hear from you as regards the instructions given
to us.
Thanks,
Email: Reply To { 
drdejipeters4@gmail.com
 }
From The Desk Of:
DR PETER  UGO  .

subject: Re:   Hello Friend,
body:
Hello DR PETER UGO,

Wow, that's quite a surprise! I had no idea my email address was found in the scam victim's list. It's really great to hear that organizations like the Monetary Fund IMF and World Bank are working together to help people like me.

I'm curious though, how did my email end up on this list? And could you tell me more about this process? How does it work exactly?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Franklin
